intro: Goniophlebium laetum, commonly known as the yellow moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and yellowish-green coloration. The plant has a delicate structure with short, branching stems and leaf-like structures that are often curved. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Goniophlebium laetum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
